intro: Ligusticopsis hispida, commonly known as the hairy ligustic, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its aromatic properties make it of interest in both horticulture and traditional herbal practices.
